description: Hands down- for its price, this is a gem on a busy street like Geary Blvd. I know it gets drowned out because it's not super bright or aesthetically pleasing on the outside. But, this place is true Italian homemade cooking. Pizzas are fabulous! Coffee is great! The woman server is a sweetheart! And I took a risk and ordered pasta for once- OMG delicious. Try it, I promise you will love it if you like good food for a decent price!
author: Urmi P.

description: This is a under acknowledged neighbourhood pizza joint.  I love the food there, especially the calzones.  The service is is always first rate.  Every time my son and I go to this restaurant the server always makes a fresh pot of coffee just for us.   If you're caught up in a rut with all these overhyped, superexpensive pizzerias in the city.  Give Bella a try.  I don't think anybody will be disappointed with the food served or the service received.
author: Piyush P.

description:
So I think I've come to the conclusion that pizza is just really expensive in these neck of the woods. 

Split a small pizza with a buddy and it came out to $25 for the pie (2 toppings on each half of the pie). 6 rather small slices for $25??

At this point I think we're all better off flying to NY and getting dollar slices.
author: Nathan K.

description: Pizza taste good. Not dry, a little oily, the kind I like. Price is high though.
author: Robert S.

description:
The best ever! We drive across town for Bella's!!!! We love the food and the service, we are treated like family! Our family has been eating here for years!!!! We have ordered for large parties and everyone loves the pizza!
We each have our favorite pizza's (from Bella special, Hawaiian special, Greco and West Coast) love it all!
My little one loves the Meatball Sub!!! ;)
This place is nothin but delicious!!!
author: Salina M.

description:
I always stop and get my pizza here on my way back to Marin. I think the pizza is really good and its not super thin or super thick crust. Fung and her family are always so friendly and warm.
My favorite is the mushroom and sausage and the ham and pineapple (which I never thought I would grow to like!).
Check it out-
author: Nancy O.

description: My favorite pizza place in the city. Relaxing place with a great family who runs it. I've been a loyal customer since 2001. Good food at reasonable prices.
author: Steven A.

description:
DON'T GET THE PASTA 

I got the baby clams linguini with garlic cream sauce. Literally no flavor, not even garlic powder??? The amount of salt I had to add instantly gave me high blood pressure, and that still didn't help so I threw in sriracha. Definitely the worst pasta I've had. Congrats.

AND THE GARLIC BREAD IS A MICROWAVED LOAF OF BREAD WITH BUTTER
author: Steff L.

description:
Bad pizza!! Soggy crust and no cheese.  

Very rude service.

I would not advise anyone to even try it
author: Mila A.

description:
Review is for the mozzarella sticks!!!!
Deep fried tempura battered mozzarella! When visiting SF, I always get these! Fiance and I love them! Want to learn how to prepare them ourselves. Lol
author: Victoria V.

description: Love this place. Been going here ever since I moved into the neighborhood four years ago. Food is always fresh, staff is always pleasant. I recommend the San Francisco with garlic.
author: Steve S.

description: This is our family's favorite dinner spot when we visit from Socal!! Our favorite pizza was called the San Francisco.  This combo pizza rocked with our fav meats & veggies.  The place is chill and our kids always feel comfortable here. We highly recommend stopping by and giving this place a try. You too will be able to taste first hand the amazingly yummy food that the entire family will appreciate.  Thank you Bella Pizza for always being a part of our SF trip and Bay Area memories!!!
author: Christine T.

description: My favorite pizza joint in SF!! I love the San Francisco with Garlic!!? It's my go to. The salads are great to.. And they carry my favorite beer PERONI!!
author: Steven N.

description:
Their pricing is not consistent with there menu (they overcharged me a few dollars and yet I still tipped for some reason with a pickup order). The lady was angry when I asked her about the pricing and she told me it was correct in a rude tone without explaining it... I paid $24.87 for a medium 2 topping pizza. Nonetheless, I was hungry and was hoping that the pizza would be great, but that wasn't the case. 

The pizza here is very bland, it was overcooked and black on the underside. The crust has nothing added to it (no garlic butter or any spice) and it was very crunchy (to the point where i cut the roof of my mouth with it). I honestly felt that Dominos has an edge on this place (and that is not saying much). Overall, mediocre pizza and customer service accompanied with a high price.
author: Daniel A.

description:
I've been coming here for over 30 years and the pizza has always been great... except for the last 2 pizzas.  Both had thin soggy crust.  I think there has been an ownership change because the woman who always took our order and the guy who always delivered are no longer there and the new people don't seem to have the baking technique down - though the ingredients seem to be the same.  I'm hoping they can improve.

Update:  They just raised their prices $3 for a large...so no, won't be ordering any more pizzas here.
author: Mike W.

description:
Bella Pizza doesn't look like much from the outside, but they certainly make a wonderful pie! It wasn't crowded on an early Sunday afternoon, so my hon of hons could watch the Seahawks get their asses beat, which made for a very upbeat experience!

The restaurant is small and kind of funky, with very sweet and professional service.  Since we each wanted something different, the three of us opted to get slices rather than a whole pie.  We went with a cheese slice with sausage, a cheese slice with garlic and pepperoni, and a cheese slice with mushrooms, roasted red peppers and meatballs, all with the traditional pizza sauce.  

What was delivered was two large slices apiece, fully loaded with the toppings we chose.  I was only planning to eat one slice, but couldn't resist eating both.  The cheese was delicious, and the crust was kind of light, but not too crunchy.  We all really enjoyed our meals!

A great find, and we will be back again.

One note to the owner:  your bathroom could use an upgrade!
author: .Hon H.

description:
More than fair.

Defined: http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/bella

Devoured: Outstanding broiled chicken sandwich with tomato sauce and parmesan cheese plus an excellent made to order slice of BBQ chicken pizza.

Former usually comes with mozzarella but they swapped no problem. Latter was doused with tomato sauce as requested and big enough to be two slices.

Meal earns them four stars. Friendly and attentive staff, 15+ year history and Buddha shrine earn them another. Plus you can't go wrong with a $10 plus tip price tag.

Five stars is only fair.
author: Jason B.

description: I was staying in this neighbourhood and needed to grab a quick supper. This place hit the spot. The atmosphere is friendly and most of the clientele seemed local. Service was friendly. My pizza was pretty good and reasonably priced. Giving this place 4-stars for being a decent neighbourhood eatery.
author: Bernard H.

description:
Guess what, people? Pizza. Is. Greasy.

I absolutely HATE it when people complain about "greasy" pizza. Has anybody ever come across a REAL pizza that wasn't greasy? We're not talking about the vegan cheese on cardboard crap some of you are used to.

I must admit, Bella doesn't have the BEST pizza, but it's good pizza. It's good pizza for a decent price. Owned by a nice family.

Service was very friendly and attentive. We ordered a medium San Francisco pizza and Linguine with clams. I didn't expect much from the linguine, but I had a small craving for linguine and clams, but it was actually decent. The sauce was a little heavy, but other than that, the pasta was cooked perfectly and the flavor was great.

The pizza was, yes, greasy. There was cheese. There was meat. Of course it was greasy! It was greasy deliciousness as most pizzas should be.

I'll be more than happy to go back to Bella's, and they even deliver (in the neighborhood).
author: Sara K.

description:
This restaurant is a stain on the neighborhood.

My large combo averaged out to $3.20 per/slice. The ingredients are fresh and abundant but the crust was not good and there was hardly any sauce. Anybody can buy fresh veggies for a combo and stack it on but not many can make quality pizza sauce and good crust. It was not greasy though. Not only was the pizza as exciting as eat as a cardboard box the employees YELLING at each other was completely unacceptable. I might have given it another chance but since the management clearly doesn't care for the comfort of their paying customers I clearly don't care to ever come back.
author: Justin S.

description:
I have been order g pizza for over 10 years and I used to love their pizza , it's really bad 
Last 2 times I ordered the pizza was horrible
The crust was not fresh and the toppings was soggy.
author: Irving S.

description:
A inexpensive spot for pizza and Italian food, but the quality just isn't there (from my experience).

The sandwich I had (chicken) was very dry, seemed freezer burned and just didn't have flavor. 

My pizza slice was ok (Hawaiian), but seemed rushed and not cooked enough.

The staff was friendly, but the product is lacking!
author: Jeff B.

description:
I ordered a small San Francisco Pizza

They where friendly owners. Nice place to eat.
The pizza was quite big. Wasn't even able to finish it completely.

It tasted ok i guess, but it wasn't one of the better pizza's i've eaten.
There is a bit too much topping on it, and quite grease, making the crust quite soggy. The cheese could be a bit more crispy.

Al and all a fair pizza for the price if your really hungry.
author: Bert V.

description: Quick and friendly service. Food came out in a very timely manner. I had the meatball and cheese submarine. The bread had a perfect crisp to the outside. A nice balance of sauce to meat to cheese. I had a side order of curly fries. Pretty standard for fries. After reading other reviews, I will be back for pizza next time.
author: Chris B.

description:
I was hungry and had no idea where to go, fortunately for me my friend was with me and recommended this place. I remember him always saying how good the pizza are so off we went. 
Parking can be a drag so the space I found on clement st was a small victory. 
I ordered the Hawaiian and we shared fries. The pizza didn't fall short of expectations, gooey cheese, good sauce, the toppings were awesome. 
The fries were very good as well, they were just how I like them, crispy exterior with a nice crunch on the ends but a soft starchy mash inside. 
The waitress, who is also the owner was so nice and sweet. 
I would definitely come back.
author: Tashi. O.

description:
I've been coming here for years.  This place is really a hidden treasure.  Looks like a dive place from the outside, but the surprise is awaits inside.  The food is really good.

Great service and good food, whats more to ask!
author: Kenneth G.

description: Always came here for great pizza. My family has been coming here for as long as I can remember and it has always been consistently good pizza. Have never been disappointed in the quality here and now I take my friends here and they have not been disappointed either.
author: Long L.

description: Solid thin crust pizza.  Sauce is well balanced, crust is tasty and toppings are fresh. Staff is always friendly and my orders are always ready when promised.
author: James C.

description:
Oh Bella! I've grown up with your pizzas!

My mother always gets take out pizza from this place whenever my grandma isn't feeling well or doesn't know what to make for dinner.

The crust is always fabulous and the toppings are always fresh! I love the fact that I don't need to put a paper towel over my slice to soak up the grease prior to eating it as well.

I remember coming here to dine in a couple of times but I think I'd rather have take out. The smell of the pizza is so enticing that makes this place a must go.
author: Mabel Y.

description: Been eating here for more than 20 years . Love the pizza. Slices are a decent size. freat Pizza
author: David M.

description:
Since Bella Pizza is around the corner from work, and when my boss is feeling friendly and treating a couple slices every now and then, it has become my Friday afternoon fantasy, and is one of the best lunch options on the block!  

I am quite appreciative at how large the slices are, and they are quite generous with toppings, although slices can be a bit pricey.  The only other thing I wish they didn't do would be to add mozzarella cheese to an already half baked crust with sauce when ordered.  I guess it makes it taste fresher than just reheating an already dressed slice but I always miss the sauce since there seems to be so little!
author: Pb J.

description: Bella Pizza is one of our favorite pizza place. The service is amazing. Pizza is great. We usually order a take out. Pizza is always ready on time.
author: Diana K.

description:
Bella Pizza has great food and a quiet but relaxed atmosphere.  There's more served here than just pizza--although this comes in a wide variety of flavors.  My own favorite: The California Special, which has even more toppings than the Bella Special.  

You can also get submarine sandwiches, half chicken, veal parmesan, New York steak, spaghetti, ravioli, fettecini, tortellini, lasagna.

The prices are what you would expect for a pizza parlor--somewhere between $25 and $45 for two people.  

It's a family-owned business with an intimate, friendly atmosphere.  And not only can you get a great meal there, you can order take-out as well.
author: Steffen W.

description: I'd give this place 3.5 stars. Its very good, service was slow, but I was in a group of 15. We ordered 3 large pizzas for 8 people and it was way too much pizza. We got one pizza with pesto, bbq chicken, and the meat pizza. All were good, but the pesto one was better. I wish they had the pesto pizza with chicken on it. The house wine was also good. It was smooth, we got the white wine. I'd definitely go back to this place, but only when its not a big group since there is not much help. The ambiance is ok and the staff is friendly. Great pizza!
author: tracey l.

description:
Honestly, I had been suggested to eat at "Bella", a different restaurant along Geary, but, alas we were on foot, weren't we Jamie M.? We gasped "We're here", went in, and chose a pizza.

You get 5 toppings (and pay for it) if you want a half and half pizza. It's a bit on the expensive side, but if you buy a large for two people, you will certainly be coming to term with a food baby after the second slice---plain language says that these slices are enormous.

Why 4 stars? It's a Vietnamese family's business and there is something special about the whole family hanging out at the restaurant. Not only that, but issues with school and the profession I'm going into caused me to engage the waitress in a dialogue about hypocrisy, "what we're meant to do" and other philosophical discussion points and she was an amazing conversationalist. Where else are you going to get that kind of time and attention from someone serving you dinner? I'd go back.
author: Davey R.

description:
Okay, I admit that I took just about forever to decide on what I want and they were very patient, which is awesome. I finally ended up getting sausage, jalapenos, mushrooms, and green peppers (and I was very relieved they didn't charge per topping [at least I think, I mean my one slice came out pretty cheap]). I was ridiculously surprised at how much of the toppings they heaped on and how big the single slice was. Oh did I mention you can get a single slice here? Which is awesome.

The other thing that surprised me was that my pizza wasn't that greasy. Yes, I know, pizza by nature tends to be greasy but I was actually surprised that with all my toppings, they eased up on the cheese (which I appreciated) and kept it pretty light.
author: Shauna S.

description: First time writing a review on yelp, and had to comment about the delicious pizza here!  Honestly my favorite pizza ever and its been great every time.  Perfect crust, great amount of cheese, no overload of sauce, and the toppings mixed into the cheese so that they don't fall off :)  Love Bella!  Also the pesto pasta is so yummy
author: Alicia R.

description:
Came through here to pick up a slice and they are pretty good.  I guess I wasn't expecting it to taste so good, which is why I was so pleasantly surprised.  But I do wish they were open late so I could grab one after a long night of drinking.

The guy making the pizzas is not a "people-person" at all.  He doesn't smile or even acknowledge that you come in, even if you say hi to him ... he won't reply.  The woman that works the counter, however, is a different story.  She was very sweet and attentive.

I have not dined-in at this restaurant yet, but it looks like a place I'd like to try.  The decorations seem a bit old and the place looks like it needs some retouching, but if the rest of the food on their menu is as good as their pizza slices ... then I'm in.
author: Pia V.

description:
We love Bella's Pizza!  The owners are super friendly and the food is great!  We have a large family and even though we live in the East Bay, we go there for birthdays, anniversaries and other family gatherings.  It's always a fun experience.  It's very homey with that old Italian charm.  

In my opinion, the crust is what makes the pizza.  Bella's is just right.  Add the toppings and sauce and you're in heaven.  We always order whole cheese, whole pepperoni and love their SF and West Coast Specialty pies.  

As mentioned, Bella's is a family tradition.  If you haven't tried it, you should.  We wish them continued success!
author: R P.

description:
I have been going to this restaurant religiously every week for the past 3 years since I moved to San Francisco. The pizza here is unparalleled to any other pizza spot in the city -- and frankly, any pizza place I've eaten at in Chicago. 

The owners (both the husband, wife) are wonderful people that keep it a family-run atmosphere. 

If you're looking to find a new addiction, go to Bella's... You won't be disappointed.
author: Alissa K.

description:
I was striking out all over the Inner Richmond last night and after a few failed attempts at other spots I tried this place for a quick bit before giving up and heading home. They produced the worst slice of pizza I've ever had. They cut a slice off a cooked crust and sauce only pie and sprinkled fresh cheese on top. What resulted was a simultaneously undercooked and dry lower half topped by grossly under cooked layer of cheese. It was astoundingly bad. Almost worth trying because it was so superlative. 

It also took a long time. I realize that slices are probably not their specialty, but if that's the best you can do, just don't even to try to offer slices.
author: M L.

description:
Ok neighborhood pizza   On par with other fine pizza joints like dominos and round table.

Ok for pizza in a pinch  otherwise keep looking

Make sure you look at the bill they have a history of making errors always in their favor.
author: Osos I.

description: Excellent Pizza without the crazy escalating San Francisco cost of living. No gimmicks, blinding menu choices, just good food at reasonable prices. I've been a loyal customer for over 10 years because the food and service brings me back. Great for families or groups of friends.
author: Steven k.

description:
Reading all of these reviews, I don't really get what all the chatter is about.

I've never dined in here and I've never ordered the pizzas myself. The only times that I have eaten pizza from here is when I go over to my cousins' place for a party. Their family always orders Bella Pizza and I guess they like it but I don't. 

When you are eating fresh, warm pizza, I expect to be able to pick up the pizza by the crust and the pizza to be just a perfect straight that I can eat easily. But with this pizza, the tip of the triangle seemed to sink and I needed to hold up the end of the pizza to eat it. 

Maybe it was because the pizza was a big slice or maybe because there were too many toppings on it. I ate this one pizza with mushrooms and some other topping that I don't remember. But there wasn't an even balance of mushrooms and... that other topping. It was just a lot of mushrooms which is probably why I don't remember what else was on that particular pizza. I'm not the biggest fan of mushrooms but if you put it in front of me, I'll eat it. But this was just a lot of mushrooms. 

I think the pizza bottom was too thin. It wasn't even a crispy thin but just thin and that probably was why it would fall down when you pick it up. The crust was... unforgettable. Since I don't remember it. 

This pizza isn't terrible, but it's not that great either. You could probably do a lot better at Round Table or Domino's if you want to order a pizza.
author: Jenny L.

description:
The perfect place for when I want pizza and he wants a hot sandwich and onion rings.

We get Bella delivered at least once a month. It's not the best pizza, but it's decent - especially for the price. In addition to several different Italian entrees, the also make hot sandwiches, fries, onion rings and apps. They pretty much have a little of everything on the menu.

Delivery is free and usually takes about 45 minutes.
author: Monarch B.

description:
Four of us had to go on a very important errand in the vicinity of Bella Pizza.  After our mission was accomplished we were all really famished and spied Bella Pizza with a parking space exactly opposite the front door.

We filed  in and started reading the vast menu.  Two decided on a pizza and Caesar Salad.  My husband and I chose to share a Chef's Salad and Eggplant Parmigiana.  It was extremely delicious.  The salad had quite a few slices of two different Italian salamis. I told the server I like a lot of salad dressing and she brought a huge amount. Everybody thought the food was as good as it could be.  The salad vegetables were very fresh and the lettuce as crisp as though it had just been harvested.  The eggplant was loaded with cheese and covered with a good sauce.   Water was replenished before it was needed.  It would be difficult to find  something negative to comment about the food even if you were an old grouch and tried hard.

I would give Bella five stars if it were a little more attractive.  The building is very old and the floor is uneven.  There is an unusual tiny step at the entrance that made me think of an accident waIting to happen.   However, if you are yearning for some good Italian food for a reasonable price, Bella Pizza is the place to go.
author: Adrienne T.

description:
Pizza = okay, at least it's edible

Other food = tolerable

Service = okay.  They have delivery too, but we've only been there for sit-down.  They were friendly, efficient, and left us alone to our meal.

Decor = crapola.
author: Fannie S.

description:
Been here a few times for the Meatball sandwich.
Good sized with plenty of meatballs, marinara and cheese on a toasted roll.

For $5.95, it's a good lunch deal.

  Basic, simple meatball sandwich; cheap and filling, what do you expect for $5.95? 

Customer service: Nice and quick.

Decor: ok, nothing fancy. clean.
author: Bert K.

description:
I've been a regular customer to Bella Pizza for over 6 years now. Ever since one of my poker buddies, ray lew, got all of us to chip in for pizza during our poker game, i've come back ever since. I have only visited the restaurant twice in my 6 year relationship with this place, but i am a most regular customer for their delivery option, which by the way, is free. I always order pizza from here because of its great value. TIP: if you order on the phone, u can just claim u have a coupon and u can get discount without actually having the coupon.

coupon goes as follows
buy a pizza, get 2nd pizza of same/lesser value for half off.
4 dollars off any xtra large pizza
3 dollars off any large pizza
2 dollars off any medium pizza
1 dollar off any small pizza
and a variety of other discounts that i cant remember or dont use enough

my favorite toppings for pizza include sausage, bacon, mushrooms, peporoni, and onion of sorts. However, i would only recommend that you get 2... maybe 3 toppings on the pizza as it may overwhelm your taste buds with such great flavor that u dont kno wtf u are putting into your mouth anymore. one thing i do that ive learned from master yoda ray lew, is that u can replace the regular tomato paste sauce with PESTO. pizza is damn near 2x better made this way; it is also less messy and melty, actually looks like pizza har har har. overall, i would recommend this place for anyone having a night in, game night, or simply a quick dinner. pizza is huge, toppings are pumped full of flavor, a 2 topping extra large pizza runs about 13 bucks with "invisible" coupon + tip, which is like 15-16dollars for a very big pizza pie, capable of serving 4-5 very hungry people.
author: simon k.

description:
i used to come here alot when i worked across the street. i'd always get a slice for lunch. 

the service was usually always great and they were super fast and cheap. 

so why only 1 star? the last time i went there (and this will explain why it was the last time) i got my friend a slice of pizza. she gave me $20 for her one slice. i did her a favor by buying her slice because she didn't have a break yet and she was hungry. anyhoo... everything went as normal. i got her a slice of sausage and mushroom.. her fave! 

a few days later the ladies that work there come in to my work and straight up accuse me of not paying for that slice of mushroom and sausage. they were so rude about it and could  have handled the situation with professionalism. my friend that i bought the pizza for was there and i tried to explain that they were mistaken. i had given my friend her slice and her change from her $20 bill that day. and if i had not paid for it.. 1. why did i get the slice of pizza? and 2. why didn't they ask me about it the same day? they knew where i worked (literally across the street)

the worst part of it was that they told me that i needed to go thank the pizza guy who pulled money out of his own pocket to cover the cost of that slice of pizza. maybe he put it in there in the first place because i would never walk out on the "bill" at a place i often go to for lunch. and again.. they know where i work so that would be stupid.

anyhoo.. i haven't stepped foot in that place since.
author: Lena H.

description: Yeah man.  Knocked back the extra large combo pie again tonight and it was just as good as the last one.....
author: Scott K.

description: I love this place and usually get 2-3 slices of extra cheese pizza and they really mean EXTRA CHEESE!
author: Ryu K.

description:
Service: Okay (only ever dined in)
Food Eaten: PIZZA!, Calzone
Price: Good
Would I come here again: YES!

This is probabaly the only pizza place that I go to now that I found it. I am a big sauce person so I love the amount that they put on here. The crust is excellent and the toppings plentiful. I brought several friends to this place and they all agree, this is the best pizza they have had!
author: Richard L.

description: Still the best pizza in the Richmond District. . . THE CITY.  Others do pizza well, but Bella's always, aways the choice anytime I need a 'za fix. Bang for the buck and flavorful as all get out. Just try one already!
author: Tristan C.

description:
This has great NYC style pizza, thick doughy crust with just the right amount sauce. Another key point is it is never greasy. We always order out and take it back to house to eat and watch the game. 

It is just a great pizza.
author: run j.

description:
Please note that I am writing this as I am diving into my third slice...

This place is good! Nizario's can suck it for sure. I ordered from there at it had too much bread and no flavor. Bella's has the taste of New York pizza (nothing is as good as NY but this is close) with the crust of just a normal pizza. It has the PERFECT amount of grease on the cheese that is just so satisfying. 

We waiting an hour and 10 min for our delivery on a Thurs night @ 9 - so get on it early. Worth it though.

A lot cheaper than Nizario's too!
author: Sam T.

description:
Every time I frequent the place I ask myself "why do you want their pizza again"? I think maybe it's because either service is soo darn friendly. maybe it's the attractive lady that rings me up at the counter. Cant really identify the real reasons why. 

The pizza selection is average. A typical range of topping selections adorn the menu and then you read a bit farther. They have Pasta and Calzones, oooh! I have had their pizza many times so I went out on a limb and tried their Fettuccine Alfredo. Wow! Way to much garlic. I felt bad for the people on the Muni Bus on my ride home, as I am sure that I was seeping pungent garlic stench through every pore on my skin. The garlic was soo overpowering that I had to give away my lunch to the local moocher. You know, every office has one. the person who asks if you are "going to finish that?". Thankfully this guy didn't care about the essence of garlic that was emanating from my floor as soon as you stepped from the elevator. 

With all that said, I still get a slice or two for lunch every once in awhile. Their slices are really big, so value is definitely a plus. I just wish they wouldn't pre-sauce their dough so I could get no red sauce and substitute for pesto. The tomato sauce they have is a bit acidic. Knowing this I still order. 

I guess the theme to this review is I am still not sure why I frequent this place. is it the convenience or the cute lady? Could be both? Either way, the pizza is average and this is the reason for a three star review. Your results may vary as I have always had lunch here, never dinner.
author: Anderson C.

description: This is my favorite pizzeria in the city and my go-to-spot if I am hungry for some pizza. Good sauce, good cheese, good crust, and fresh ingredients. I am from the East Coast and I am very surprised by the lack of good pizzerias in the city, and also by what most SF people consider to be good pizza. I am very happy Bella delivers to my neighborhood :)
author: Omar A.

description: Asian owned and operated, $12 minimum for cards, sweet icky pizza sauce, flavorless cheese, cheese sticks tasted like donuts, bad salad dressing served... It is what it is, take it or leave it. I'll probably go back once or twice more in the future since it is close by.
author: Libra J.

description: I must admit I thought the place was closed when I first walked up because the doors were closed and the storefront is generally not very open.  Fortunately they were open for business and super friendly too.  The regular crust is akin to that of a pan crust from Pizza Hut; thick and chewy.  The all-meat special was a bit too salty for me, but the fiesta balanced that out a little.  I really liked the fiesta.  Why did I never think to put jalapenos and Tabasco sauce together on a pizza before?  Delicious.
author: Jenn C.

description: Hit or miss - Bella's pizza's best features (so cheesy and gooey, and loaded with toppings) can also be its downfall -- sometimes the crust is quite soggy, and the toppings and cheese slide right off the crust.  Toppings are inconsistent, especially the veggie ones. Sometimes they're so damned fresh and delicious, sometimes they're vile and almost inedible.  Since there's no way to know what you're getting, I hesitate to buy one of their (fairly overpriced) pies and tend to buy by the slice.   As mediocre as I make them sound, they're still probably the best pizza in the Richmond, and deliver within a reasonable time.
author: Heidi M.

description:
Normally I would have given Bella 5 stars but last night I was quite disappointed in their pizza.  I guess it's a new thing but my pizza had a glaze of garlic butter on top of the pizza sauce that threw off the flavor completely.  I mean, who eats a Hawaiian pizza with garlic and butter.  

I guess next time I'll make sure to specify that I don't want that on my pizza.  Other than that, their prices are reasonable, delivery is faster than what they promise, and the quality of pizza is good.

I would still go back.
author: Angelica R.

description: One of the only places I know where I can get a slice of my fav pizza and a small order of fries!  My comfort food!  Been coming here since I was in elementary school and even though its changed management a handful of times, the food always hits the spot!
author: Anna L.

description:
Ive only had their pastas and its not bad. Kind of saucy but still yummmm and big portions! 

The seating is kind of dark and cozy.
author: Amy S.

description:
Had a good meaty pizza here and it was tasty and very cheesy. Delivered it within 30 minutes and piping hot. 

I've been here for lunch twice with a good size group and we ordered 3 different types of pizza and everyone enjoyed it.I'll be back.
author: M M.

description:
Hungover on a Sat morning is no big surprise for me. DYL much? But this was the first time that I'm hung over and helping a friend put stuff into storage. I knew this wouldn't be easy when walking up Larkin to catch the 38 felt like a daunting task. So of course, I need food and lots of it. 

Wanting something new, I leave a little earlier than planned so I can grab some grub at a new place in the Inner Richmond. Buckshot was closed so no food there. Pho? Too sit downey, need to make this fast (though I do believe that Pho is the perfect hangover food). So I step into Bella Pizza. 

Murals of Italy adorn the walls along w/ pictures of vineyards and other landscapes. The menu is pretty extensive but I don't see pizza by the slice prices. I just decide on the gyro ($6 and some change). 

1. tender juicy lamb, well seasoned and cooked to order. 
2. pillowy soft flat bread tasted fresh. 
3. cool yogurt sauce to add creamy texture and was a good counterpart to the hot lamb. 
4. made in about 10 mins (like I said, made to order) 

The only thing w/ it though, it was a little small. I mean, I'm about to do some heavy lifting and my entire head is throbbing like an open vain. I need sustenance and for $6 I should get a pretty decent portion. So it was a little over priced. 

Overall, it was a decent experience, but next time I want food in bulk, Burger King is at Geary and 3rd Ave.
author: Angelo F.

description:
If you are not a metabolic god who can effortlessly maintain a svelte physique, this place is not for you, because the pizza from Bella is just..totally...FAT..as in like PHAT or whatever the cool way to say luscious and heavy with cheese is.. I have tried one or 2 other delivery places who's names I forget, and they have always, always disappointed..usually too expensive with crappy toppings but OMFG Bella. Loaded down with cheese and toppings on an outstanding, yummy bready crust that I often go for first, because it just tastes that good.

All that being said, I am not a metabolic god so I can only order this heavenly, cheesy, bready indulgence about twice a year but wow..that's two dinners and two morning's leftovers of pizza-positive, mouth watering affordable delight. I usually order the vege {onions, mushrooms, tomato, olives} with sausage and sun dried tomatoes.  Order early on weekends or game nights, because Bella is very, very popular.

I am going to have to work out now, because I am for sure ordering one this weekend.
author: Sharon J.

description:
Me gusta Bella!  

A- When we call for pick-up the cool gal Phuong knows us.
B- Their french fries, are off the hook!  I have a feeling they fry it in the same oil they fry the Fish N Chips in but that's what makes 'em so good.
C- Like someone else on here said, their pizza slices are really two slices, and they'll make whatever kind of slice you want.
D- When you dine in and order a soda they bring you a glass with ice to pour your can soda into.  I always get Coke and it is always the best little coke in the world.  That combo:  Coke, Glass &Ice= 5 stars.
E- Their fish and chips!
F- Their Chicken Fettucini Alfredo is A-OK!
G- Their Mozzarella sticks!
H- Their menu has a little something for everybody.  
I-   They take credit-card
K- Sold!


Me Gusta Bella!
author: Marisa M.

description: Not a true Italian-style pizzeria.  The garlic bread is simple, and looks like something I could have made out of cardboard.  Don't expect to get refills on sodas, as they rip you off by selling cans only.  I wouldn't dine-in again...probably good for take out and deliveries.  It has a varied menu, ranging from burgers on a sub and fish & chips, which reminds me of a Mr. Pizza Man.  Although, it's the only place we've ever found that has green olives.  For a large size pizza with 10 sizes, it was quite thick and plenty for a family of four.  Service was friendly, and the evironment was cozy and suitable for kids.
author: Christine R.

description:
YUM. Excellent crust, sauce and cheese. 

The executive who saved the day (offered up his credit card when our department's card didn't work) said "yes, please!" when I offered him a piece of thank-you-for-saving-us pizza. "But don't tell them I'm in the office today!" Great... so it looks like I took two HUGE pieces instead of just  the one. But hey, it's great pizza, and it was quickly delivered to our door, piping hot. 

Not sure why someone said they only take cash for delivery. I just used a credit card for our company's pizza delivery.
author: Wendy M.

description: I ordered a Pep, Mush, and Cheese pizza for delivery and I was impressed! It was cheesy, hot and yummy! The crust was perfect. Can't complain...
author: Carla F.

description:
After our attempts at dining at Bella (the nearby restaurant on Geary Street), we made our way down to Bella Pizza. They were open until 11pm on a Tuesday (which I guess is late for this part of town since everything else seems to close at 9:30pm), so we walked in and gave it a shot.

This place is run by a bunch of asians who really love Christmas (which is not a bad thing, just unexpected). The non-stop Christmas carols and Christmas light-lined walls was a bit much. My girlfriend singing every single Christmas song that came on made me want to stab myself in the eyes. If you hate Christmas tunes, come check this place out in January.

From just guessing, you'd think this was the kind of place that used frozen ravioli and jar sauce. While I can't speak for the ravioli, the sauce tasted fresh, which was a nice surprise. The salami, pepperoni, and mushroom calzone was very good and tasty. The calzones run the same size as the pizzas, so a 12" (the smallest size) is probably good for 1 hungry person or 2 sorta hungry people.

Overall, not bad. Not the best, but if I were in the area, I'd come back. Just not during the Christmas season.
author: Alexis C.

description:
Cheesiest Pizza in SF!!

This is really yummy stuff. They use only the best ingredients and don't skimp on the real mozzarella... only one caution they can sometimes use too little sauce for my taste...excellent delivery!

Recommended dishes: House combination Pizza and Greek Salad
author: zoe s.

description:
Time to update this review.  Don't be fooled by the mere 4 star review - this is my favorite delivery in the city.

Yes, this is the best pizza delivery in the entire city.  I give my absolute highest recommendation to the sausage and ricotta pizza.  My roommates and I have tried everything from basic pepperoni to chicken and bacon pizza to pesto, artichokes and olives - and every single time the pizza has blown the competition out of the water.  

Really, really - do yourself a favor, and eat this pizza.  You can thank me afterwards.
author: Matthew H.

description:
I'll give it three stars... The pizza was alright, the portions were big... The pricing was also decent.... I guess the only thing wrong with it is that it's with walking distance of Nizario's (3 blocks away), and I just like Nizario's better... My suggestion? Bella's is ok... but walk down the street 3 more blocks, and have a slice at Nizario's instead.

You'll thank yourself. And me. ;)
author: Elle Q.

description:
This is the kind of place you walk into and the gal behind the counter memorizes what you drink even after only meeting you once.  "The usual?" she asks, my reply "yes, please".  

"The usual" here consists of 1 extra large combo, 1 large pepperoni and enough drinks for 5-12 guys.  My friends and I have been coming to this place every Tuesday night (go tribe!) religiously for the last 3 to 5 years.

What I love about this place is simple: great service, great prices and most importantly, GREAT PIZZA!!!

Now, you should know this about me, I take my pizza ratings very seriously.  5 stars is a rare award given to only 'top shelf organizations'.  Well, rest assured, Bella Pizzeria qualifies.  The pizza is sweet, chewy, non-greasy and very delicious.  The service is all smiles.  The patrons in the establishment are your 'run-of-the-mill-average-joe-and-janes'...

These are the folks that make up a good pizza joint.  Nothing foo-foo, nothing pretentious...just some darn good pizza!
author: Scott H.

description: Ate here with a friend who suggested the place. Anyway, I love the fact that the tomato sauce wasn't overwhelming on the slice of "WestCoast" that I ordered. It tasted just right although the chicken pieces could've tasted better. The spaghetti was just right also. The one thing I look out for at restaurants are servers that are attentive to their diners and they were at this place always asking if we were doing ok or asking if we needed more water.
author: Gerard Y.

description: $2.75 per slice for cheese which was very tasty.  I believe their secret ingredient is - olive oil.  It's a nice place with room to sit comfortable inside.  Friendly service and giant slices.
author: Jeff J.

description:
Just a neighborhood spot that does the job.

They have pizza, just about anything they can throw into a fryer (cheese sticks, three different kinds of french fries, four different kinds of seafood: scallops, shrimp, fish, & calamari; you get the picture), and varieties of pasta.
author: kate r.

description: Best in sf I have been going here since 1996  when i tell my friends and family they  are good they laugh and say they must be good YOUR SO DAMN PICKY (PROUD OF IT WHAT CAN I SAY I'M SICILIAN I KNOW GOOD FOOD : ) : ). The pizza is perfect from the crust to the toppings and cheese. One thing they do not do is they do not skimp on toppings or the cheese. Pesto pasta is really good as well as their calamari & garlic cheese bread. I have to say everything is good here from the FOOD to the variety of food they have which a lot of places do not have. I have family in San Jose and Tracy CA and they always ask me to bring Bella Pizza Every time i visit them !!
author: Jay J.

description:
My brother in law used to own a pizza place in the Mission where I actually also worked for about 6-7 years.  It closed in 2002 or 2003 so I do miss all that FREE Pizza we used to eat.  

But Bella comes as close to it as anyone else.  I believe the person who taught Bella how to make their pizza was the same people who trained my brother in law's place.  At least that is what I heard.  

So whenever I want to have some "nostalgic" pizza, I always order from here.  They are less expensive than many of the other pizza joints and yet are still very good.  And they don't skimp on the toppings either.   

Their delivery times can sometimes take long but we usually do a pickup anyways since we are in the same district.....
author: Mark W.

description:
I got wind of Bella Pizza from a coupon in one of those blue envelopes you get in the mail.  I ordered a zuchinni, green olives, black olives and mushroom thick crust pizza.  It was really good! I liked the fact that the green olives were plump and juicy, not like those sad, dried out types you get in most pizza places. The cheese was milky and not overly salty, which is my personal preference. They also have a pretty extensive 'topping menu'. Lots to choose from.  

Only downside was the 1 hour long wait and the fact that the takeout menu I used was old and their prices had increased by a few bucks.  But the coupon was valid so I was happy.
author: Smruti S.

description:
I live several blocks away and occasional get pizza from here. I usually have my delivery in about 45 minutes.

The pizza is not out of sight, but it's better than the chain stores. Whether it's Bella or some place near you, support a local pizzeria!
author: Andrea S.

description:
Best Pizza in the Richmond District. 

They've got the fastest delivery, great prices (they always give you coupons and never take them back when you use them) and great tasting pizza. 

Give the Pepperoni sandwich a shot too, you won't regret it.
author: Justin B.

description:
Que Bella! A little pizza joint on Geary (eat in or delivery) that serves up a pretty good and inexpensive pizza. Get it delivered or pick it up but if I were you I'd take it home because the ambiance is about as exciting as canned marinara forgotten on the shelf. 

I suggest the Bella Special, it's a first cousin to the first born at Orgasmica, "The Orgasmica" and the place is never as crowed as the Clement Street pizzeria. It's my 'other' pizza place in the Richmond.
author: Jessica D.

description:
The good rating is based on three huge factors; (1) pretty scrumptious pizza, (2) fast delivery, and (3) decent prices.

With Bella I know what I'm getting each time.  The thin crust (always preferred) pizza comes with a generous amount of toppings and cheese.  The sauce isn't oozing out of the slices either.  Can I get a better pie elsewhere?  Probably.  But I would say it is above average.

Last night we had the Hawaiin Special (pineapple, ham, bacon) and I added shrooms.  I had more than I was supposed to.  I knew it was good because every bite felt theraputic.  In the morning I had it straight outa the fridge.  It was dee-lish cold, too!

Haven't had any other dishes.  In all honesty, I would go to an Italian restaurant for Italian dishes.  As for pizza, Bella is always reliable, fast, and affordable.
author: Pete M.

description: Worse pizza I've ever tasted.   Christ, pizza is basically a big saltine cracker with tomato sauce, cheese and other crap on top.  Not rocket science, but these guys managed to get it wrong.  Cold, under cooked, nasty.
author: Mike m.

description:
Bella Pizza is where you can get a slice of delicious looking melty, cheesy pizza.  When I took a friend, I told him it's the physical manifestation of a cheesy cartoon pizza.  After trying it, he agreed.

I used to work at the Green Appleseed on Clement, and my co-workers and I were always looking for a good cheap, filling meal.  We were all kind of sick of chinese, thai, japanese, ETC all the time, so my co-worker tipped me off on Bella.

I don't work on Clement anymore, but I still eat at Bella and will take friends there when the occasion is right! (ie cheap, fast, filling, and yummy)

So, the thing is, it's only around $2.50 for a cheese slice -- but it's ACTUALLY 2 slices.  You can add all sorts of toppings for more.  

It's nice and cozy and Italiany inside - makes me feel Sopranos-y.

This place gets 4 stars for the qualities i listed - cheap, fast, filling, and yummy.
author: Liz C.

description:
5 stars, people? ..really?

we randomly ordered from here one friday night and it was the hugest, most disappointing pizza experience of my life. 

first of all, we forgot to tell them on the phone to make our crust thin so i called them back LITERALLY 2 mins later and the woman who i'd just talked to put me on hold for 45 seconds and when she gets back on, she says it's too late. the pizza's been put in the oven.

ummm.. really??! REALLY? because when i'd talked to her 2 mins and 45 secs earlier, she said it was going to be 45 mins til it would be delivered (and we're a 3 min. car ride away) so i found it really hard to believe the pizza had actually been put in the oven in that time. 

whatever, or maybe it had. in which case she should have offered to make another one, but she didn't. she just sorta said, "ok? ok," and that was the end of our convo. NOT IMPRESSED.

pizza arrived fast, but as i soon found out, at the expense of the pizza itself. it didn't taste fully baked. the artichokes were basically raw and there was absolutely no crispiness to the pepperoni. gross.

we also ordered "buffalo wings," and i put them in quotations because they were the smallest, saddest, most preserved, sorry excuses for wings i have ever had. they looked genetically modified. gross x 2.

we ended up composting half of the pizza the next day, which was sad. i guess there's a reason i hadn't had bella since i was a stoner in college..
author: Kay L.

description:
We don't usually do delivery pizza, but this was just one of those nights when I was feeling too lazy to cook. The reviews looked good, so we gave Bella Pizza a try. Great ingredients, well-prepared, and HOT! It was even a cold night! 

We just had a pepperoni pizza and two cokes, but it really hit the spot. The dough was a medium-thick, moreso than we normally choose, but it was very good quality, with a nice taste and texture. Plus, the dough was cooked all the way through, which sometimes doesn't happen in the slightly thicker crusts. 

We did have to wait a bit, but it was a Friday night, so that was understandable. We'll be sure to order from them again.
author: Geri J.

description:
Steve and I used to go to Bella about once a week.  Sure it was partly because we lived only a block away, but it was also the pizza.  The first few times I went there I was way unimpressed, but then, about two years ago, something happened and the pizza got WAY BETTER.  I don't know what it was, but I was quite pleased.  
THEY HAVE THE BEST GROUND BEEF.  Order spaghetti and meatballs, meatball pizza or the hamburger sub.  So so good.  I really like just the plain dinner salad.  The lettuce is always crisp and cold, they put some tomatoes and some olives and pepperoncinis on it, get blue cheese dressing on the side, it's delicious.  The pasta dishes are pretty good, and the appetizers are all fine, pretty typical greasy snacks.  

Also, they have really really cheap pitchers of Bud.  On weeknights Steve would order one with two glasses, pour some into each glass, and then switch back and forth between them, so it wouldn't look like he was drinking two pitchers of beer all by himself with his pizza.  

And they have orange soda in cans.  Which is what I like.
***The cops from the 6th Ave station eat here.  My dad always told me that you wanna eat where the cops eat.
author: melissa r.

description: Overpriced yet delicious! I paid $17 for a medium 2 topping pizza, which seems a bit high, but I must say it just might have been worth it. The one thing Bella Pizza (not to be confused with Bella from Twilight) doesn't skimp on is cheese. Oh how I love cheese! It was such a pleasant surprise! Toppings were good (olives and tomatoes) and the crust was the perfect size thickness. I'm so glad they're so close to my house!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Our go-to pizza place in the Inner Richmond when we're too lazy to walk to Giorgio's. We usually order a salad to get a minimal amount of nutrition in on pizza night, but the spinach salad was awful and we're scared to order anything else non-pizza.

The pizza is done right, however.

Update: completely not afraid to order non-pizza things now. The fried chicken wings are excellent, as are the french fries. Hot wings are pretty good, too. I just found out they offer dessert (chocolate mousse, cheesecake, tiramisu), too, but it isn't on their take-out menu.
author: Stacy J.

description:
Thank you Bella for your awesome cheese pizza and thank God your dough doesn't taste a day old like A Slice of New York! Crust is nice and crispy.

This is not a perfect 5 stars b/c there is something missing maybe because I didn't like it when the cheese does not stick to the dough. Both slices that I had the cheese came right off as a whole on first bite. Still a freaken darn good pizza though!
author: Justin L.

description:
Meh. If you've had a few drinks and you want a quick pizza, you're better off going to Nizario's down the street. And if you're looking for some good Italian cuisine, this sure ain't the place. 

In other words, just look elsewhere.
author: Roman H.

description:
I really like this place.  It's not expensive as other pizza places around the area and they have lots of toppings to choose from.  One of my personal favorites is:
Artichoke
Sundried Tomatoes
Chicken

I've only had it with the tomato sauce, but I think pesto would make it pretty good too.
author: Tim L.

description:
I used to go here more often, but I still remember the garlic and clam pizza. Fisherman's choice Yum

Good service, good pizza 3.5 stars
author: Judy K.

description: Great pizza, nice crunchy crust. I think that my favorite thing about this place is the irony that it is owned by an Asian family. They're super nice!
author: Hunter S.

description:
I and Bella Pizza go a long way back, to when the greek folks used to run it... The crazy greek folks that is. But I absolutly adore the sisters, who are running this place now. Look this is not the best pizza, calzone, salad, pasta place ever. The four stars are for the great conversations me and my best friend have shared there. For some reason this is our go to place, we can sit here for hours, laughing, and remembering the good old days.

NOW... the pizza is not the best, but definetly edible, as the calzones. I have had better... there is no doubt about that. They have that creamy garlic mushroom pasta, one of our favorites. I always order the lasagne, not the best I ve had, but I love the cheesi-ness of it, and the sauciness... way too much pasta layers within that lasagne, but I still always order it.
But we love the friendly service, and it makes us feel at home, I can put my feet up on an empty chair and just kick back, while the owner comes over to chat with us. 
This place tends to get busy for delivery, just like any other place open late with reasonable prices, and pizza.
author: yana Z.

description:
The place is very nice: they make one of the best pizza.
Service is alright, i wouldn't say the best, but I defenetly want to leave them good tips. They have also other food (meals) that are very tasty and wells prepaid for their "clients". I go there often, and everytime I enjoy being there.
author: Jenna F.

description:
Bella Pizza is good cheap pizza!!! I have tried a few pizza places in this area and this one is my favorite so far. The Cable Car pizza is really good!! I have gotten it twice and added articokes to it once!! YUMMY The crust is good and that's important!!

If you want good cheap pizza in the Richmond go to Bella!! Sorry but ZA pizza is still my favorite in San Francisco but Bella Pizza is in second place!!
author: Stacey L.

description:
Thank you Yelpers!!  I've only ordered delivery and I have to say OMG, can it get any better than this?? NO!!

First, there's the fabulous fresh dough of which I could eat every last bite.  And, then the best meats - ground beef that actually tastes like ground beef - go figure!  This place is as awesome as the hole in the wall joint my dad took us to as kids.  We'd watch Uncle Sid make our pizzas and he'd let us put anything on them we wanted.  This was my first true gourmet pizza experience experimenting with eggplant, peppers, salami, olives, and anchovies.  Then mysteriously, sometime in the early 1980s all the pizza places got together and decided to stop offering green olives - man, this really pissed me off!!  Finally, decades later and in my adopted home by the bay - a pizza place with really great deli meats and, yes, wait for it --- green olives!!  Now, I feel like I have a slice of my childhood whenever I'm hungry.
author: Ann W.

description:
We have consistently ordered from Bella Pizza for years. 
You can request thin crust, for those of you trying to lower the carbs. 
I love the crust and making this transition was hard for me but it's really ok. 

It's the only place we order from, after trying different ones out all over the Sunset and the Richmond. They are generous w/ the toppings and sauces. 

Good customer service, they remember you, delivery is in timely manner most times - ok a few times they have been late, beyond the time they said, but we forgive them, we love them. They apologized profoundly, they really care.
author: Theresa L.

description: My husband and I eat here for the pasta.  We have it on our list to try the pizza sometime but after being overcharged for basic pasta dishes elsewhere we were happy to find a solid tasty place to eat in or have delivered.  We especially love the mixed vegetables with garlic. Yum!
author: Kim M.

description:
I came to this place because I got an ad in the mail.  Whenever I receive ads, I always figure that the place needs help with their business, but I checked the reviews on Yelp, and their food sounded like it was pretty good.

Their pizza was good.  I ordered a small, and it was your typical pizza, although their crust was a little thin on the bottom, so it got a bit soggy after sitting in the box five minutes.  The actual taste was pretty good, though.  Inside the box, I also found two little containers of parmesan cheese and crushed pepper. :)

I also ordered the buffalo wings.  They were a bit disappointing.  Their wings aren't the bbq kind, in case you're into the kind with bbq sauce.  They're slightly spicy, so that was good for me.  (I don't like it when the spiciness kills your tastebuds.)  The major problem I had was the SIZE!  I ordered six, and they looked like they were from a cornish game hen or something.  Definitely not meat-filled, if that's what you're looking for.  On the plus side, they also came with some buttermilk ranch dressing.  Good taste.

I ordered their caesar salad, and that was a bit disappointing.  It tasted kind of like it just had plain Italian dressing on it with some parmesan cheese mixed in and croutons on top.  They didn't give much salad either. :[

Lastly, I also had their fries.  Yes, fries from a pizza place.  What can I say?  I was really in the mood for some fries.  Their fries were kind of typical diner fries..  Greasy....  Didn't have much salt on them, but at the time I was really craving fries, so they did hit the spot.  They weren't dry or anything, which was good.  They gave me four packets of ketchup to go with my fries, which was way more than enough for me.

If you're looking mainly for pizza, then yes, the pizza is good.  Anything beyond that was only so-so, although the flavor was good, the portions seemed a bit skimpy..  Luckily, I got filled up on the fries, one buffalo wing, a few bites of salad, and a slice of the pizza, but if you only order a salad or just an order of buffalo wings, you're going to be left hungry.

For someone who's not picky, though, and was craving certain tastes, I did get the tastes I wanted. :)
author: Keiko N.

description:
When I used to live in the dorms in berkeley, we were warned about pizza companies that don't really exist, placing ads on our door handles.  They said these were just crackheads with an oven, cooking pizza in their house.

When my roommate told me there was pizza in the fridge, i got excited.  I heated it up (it was 2 hours old), and started to eat it.  Yeah, the bacon tasted good (it's bacon, they don't get credit for that), but I SERIOUSLY thought that John had bought pizza from one of these shady operations.  

It's pretty bad pizza.  There is too much dough, the cheese does not attach itself well to the bread, and the ingredients are subpar.  

If you know of a pizza place that already gives you good pizza, there is no reason to experiment with this less than so-so pizza.

Was going to give one star, but since I only went once, it's possible that I got totally screwed.
author: Michael P.

description:
There's more here than just Pizza!

Its all Italian, all good, and reasonably priced. Large quantities and great quality. It ain't a 5 star, super swank-e, guaranteed to get laid if you take a date here kinda place, but I've never been disappointed with anything I've ordered here!
author: Dr. L.

description: Best pizza in richmond, fast and reliable,very tasty and filling but the pizza is pricey.
author: M. R. C.

description:
Good, cheap pizza.  It's not inspiring or anything, but solid.

Delivery can be anything from very fast (15 minutes) to glacially slow (90 minutes) depending on the time and day you call.  The thing is, and this is what I really appreciate about them, is that they'll tell you if it's going to be a long time.  I don't care if they're fast or slow, just as long as I know what to expect and can plan accordingly.
author: Eric W.

description: The atmosphere is beautiful! I walked in and was greeted in a friendly way :) the family that works there is very nice! The food was pretty good; I would definitely come back again and recommend it for others! :)
author: John L.

description:
I'm sooo disappointed that I only discovered this place a month or two before leaving the Richmond District. The delivery times of up to an hour are a little long, but the pizzas are invariably worth the wait. The sauce is tasty, they don't skimp on the toppings, and whatever it is that they do with garlic (which I generally don't like on pizza) borders on genius.

I miss you Bella Pizza.
author: Justin C.

description: Bella is our go-to place for take-out pizza. they have a wide selection of toppings and different specialty pizzas...and they have always tasted delicious! the cable car is among our favorite, but we usually split the pizza in half to try other toppings. we recently ordered one of their pesto pizzas, and everything tasted so fresh. they don't skimp out on the toppings, and there is a good balance of sauce and cheese...awesome!
author: Lisa B.

description: Love it! Service with a smile, great pizza (a lttle doughy) but still great.....Quaint indoor seating located on a fun stretch of Geary Boulevard :)
author: Paul M.

description: I love Bella's! I usually order a slice of sausage, mushroom and pineapple and an order of the fried shrimp with their bomb ass cocktail sauce. Yum! I've had a taste of a few of their pastas and even those are good!
author: Ashley C.

description: I usually just walk over here and get a slice because 1 slice = 2 huge slices of pizza. That's what I love about Bella's. Well that, and I love the crust on their pizzas. I've gotten fries here too and they are fucking delicious as well. The service is great.
author: Jasleen K.

description: I was introduced to this place by a flyer they left in my lobby, and it became a long-time favorite. Then careful inspection of my credit card one month revealed a duplicate charge for a date I had ordered from them, and bogus charges on three different dates the following week. After contacting them several times, I finally was called back by a less-than-apologetic woman who described it as a bookkeeping error that couldn't be corrected on their end because they had no way of reversing charges! She suggested two solutions - I could get four pies in the future at no charge, or file a dispute with my credit card company she assured me they wouldn't fight, as if she was doing me a favor. Considering their shifty way of doing business, I opted for the latter, and never patronized them again. It's a pity, too, because the pizza was terrific.
author: Gourmet G.

description: ..... so...... my sister made me do an update on my review. she wanted me to add that the food poisoning situation happened 7 years ago..
author: Bianca W.

description: I love it! I get delivery from here all the time. I haven't tasted anything yet that has been bad. They have really good meatballs and their pizza is off the hook. Yummy.
author: Maya L.

description: Used to get delivery from them quite frequently, and for the most part they're pretty okay.  I have, um, hazy memories of getting their all meat pizza which features bacon - honestly though, it's more like bacon fat.  Yummers when you're all hazy and such, but the next morning it's kinda gross to look at the globs of bacon fat (of course, it being bacon, it didn't stop us from eating the leftovers).
author: Sus... B.

description: Decent pizza, great pasta, good sandwiches.  Great delivery and customer service.  Delivery always fast and reliable.
author: Jason H.

description: I'm a frequent Bella Pizza diner, though I almost always do take out/delivery.  I ask for my pizza crust well done so that it's a little bit crispy and not soggy as I've read some other reviews mention.  (This was suggested by one of the staff--who are very welcoming and friendly.)  The same goes for the calzones which have fast become my favorite.  Try the steak fries and chicken tenders.  Their jalapeno poppers (esp the cheddar ones) are delish and for a quick greasy snack why not try the garlic cheesy bread.  The menu is extensive and there isn't much on it that I haven't tried or wouldn't order again.  Definitely one of my favorite pizza joints.
author: Marie B.

description:
i can't place it - the reasons why the pies here are so bad. i can only guess that there are multiple reasons, because of the magnitude of the bad.

i've been left feeling mildly sick and very lethargic after ordering from here. 

then again, pizza is one of the most wildly argued types of food in the world. from thin to thick, the range of conservative to outlandish toppings, types of sauce, water sources - it's pretty crazy.

in my opinion though, avoid the place.
author: Darrell L.

description: I came here in a drunken stupor and devoured with the help of a few friends pepperoni pizza, meatballs, wings and stuffed mushrooms.  It was all the perfect amount of grease to soak up the alcohol.  I have to say though the wings didn't cut it.  Not enough sauce on the bad boys.  And we all know that wings are a vehicle for the sauce.  Everything else was excellent.  I would come back again if I was in the hood.  It was also nice that it was open late.
author: Ke-Bear Z.

description: I've forgotten how frustrating it is order pizza from places like Volare, where the person who picks up the phone can hardly understand you when ordering a pizza, and you wind up having to repeat yourself 5 times. I called up Geary St. pizza and someone who speaks english clear as day answered. It took me 20 seconds to place my order and the food was here within 30 minutes. The delivery driver was cool and the pie was hot. As for the taste .. it is some of the best pizza I've had since moving here. The ingredients taste fresh ... unlike a lot of other places that taste like it came out of a frozen pizza package. I think this is going to be my new pizza place :)
author: Billy K.

description: another naybahood spot. solid pizza. economical. pasta sucks. 6 wings wouldn't nourish a starving child in Kigali. steak sandwich would be approved by the one they call Ronnie Dobbs. love it
author: aidan m.

description: It's really more like a 3 star because I never remember to order from them. That says something right?
author: Elsa T.

description:
If all you want is a thick pizza loaded with grease, cheese, and the most generous amount of toppings look no where else. It's the only place in the Richmond that consistently delivers a pizza that looks worthy of being used for advertisement...you know, the kind other places will show in pictures but what you really get in reality is a very wimpy version.

Once their new takeout menu is printed, go grab a copy. They always have the same money-off coupons in them. $4 off XL, $3 off L, and so on. Hope it remains the same.
author: Shan W.

description: I've never had anything here except pizza, and their pizza is amazing. Very cheesy, and even the crust is good. If you buy by the slice, you actually get two! The woman who works there is really nice and friendly. The only thing I did not like was I once ordered delivery and the guy was really rude. Everyone I've ever had delivery from in the city brought it to my apartment, and he made some comment about why I didn't meet him. For your info, I had a broken foot, so you coming up one more level of stairs wouldn't have killed you. Also, they only take cash for delivery. Weird, right? I was caught off guard. Anyway, great pizza, questionable delivery, but the woman in the restaurant is really nice.
author: j s.

description: Bella Pizza is great!  They have the craziest menu.  They have everything from pizza to jalapeno poppers to fish and chips.  I really like the veggie pizza and their raviolis (marinara or pesto).  The side salad is not worth the extra money for the dinner, you get lettuce, one tomato and a pepperoncini.  If I get the dinner I get the minestrone soup but I usually go a la carte on the pasta dish.  I love eating at the restaurant because of the music and their waitress is always nice.  You never have to wait for a table and they serve you your food pretty fast.
author: Lauren B.

description:
recently just went here with few family and we weren't even going to this place but it smelled so good from the outside.. 

we did the sit down and it was empty... it was cozy and the greeted us right away, service was good.. they were quick on things and the pizza was great! it was very tasty and yummy... we also ordered a salad which 3 people shared and it was yummy as well... we got garlic bread it was good but i think i had better.

prices were good too.
author: Tati T.

description: Decent pizza - for the west coast, of course.  Pesto pizza is especially good.  Good prices.  Delivery!
author: Cara C.

description: They have EXCELLENT regular cheese pizza slices. You don't even need any topping because the slices are THAT good. I also absolutely love their salmon subs and gyros. In the salmon subs there is a bit of tomatoe sauce that is perfection!
author: Nicole W.

description:
pizza that has thin crust = frowns
pizza that has a pool of grease = frowns
pizza shop owned and operated by asians = confused


killer cheese sticks though like whoah.
author: Amanda M.

description: We have been ordering from Bella Pizza for years.  I love their sausage, mushroom and garlic pizza.  Love their pizza.
author: Eatalot Y.

description: When I ordered a hawaiian pizza I was not expecting what I got. The pizza came and it had pineapple, canadian bacon AND real bacon! I thought this was awesome so I have ordered here a few more times and have not been dissapointed... except by the long delivery time and the 5+ minutes I waited on hold one night... I guess I could just walk over and pick it up... nah. Good cheese, tasty sauce and a lot of BACON!
author: Troy K.

description: This is one of my favorite pizza places ever! I'm not an expert, I just know what I like. Pizza I usually get here is a weird combo of Bacon, Mushroom, Pesto with Red Sauce. Plus the service is nice. The waitress who usually helps us is super sweet and nice. It's just an overall great spot.
author: B-Rai B.

description: Pizza is not that great, not to far from Costco's. Inside dough was a bit under cooked. Tried ordering a 2 topping half and half and they wanted to charge for 4 toppings! No other place has ever been so greedy!
author: Monkeysign M.

description: om nom nom!  Bella Pizza is the best.  My ultimate favorite is there Hawaiian pizzas.  They add bacon on top!  Delivery is fast and friendly!
author: Russ B.

description: I've only been here once and I felt satisfied with my order of the linguine with clams, along with the chicken noodle soup.  Portions were huge, price was pretty reasonable, and I received fast and friendly service.  The food kept me warm and silenced my hunger, but it's no spectacular cuisine.
author: Wella A.

description: In the words of Janet Jackson's song, "Nasty Boys".....'Who's that eating all that nasty food??" Unfortunately It was me. Holy Hell this place is awful! I was having another one of those lazy Sundays after a night out at the bars and decided to order some delivery. The woman on the phone had a major attitude for absolutely no reason, and did not seem very familiar with the menu. I went ahead and ordered anyhow because I wanted to give a new pizza joint a chance. My boyfriend and I ordered the appetizer platter of mozzarella sticks, jalapeno poppers, and chicken strips along with a gyro and cup of chicken noodle soup. Every single item we ordered was atrocious! I've had some disappointing food before just like anybody else, but this was ridiculous! I would've done a better job myself if I had just gone to Foods Co. and threw the frozen junk food in the oven myself! The mozzarella sticks were so pathetic they were almost picture worthy, and the chicken noodle looked radio active. Campbell's Soup does it better for god's sake! I would even go as far as to say I've had better cafeteria food. Needless to say, $30 down the drain. This place is trash.
author: Katie S.

description: I love Bella, but I'm downgrading them to a 3 star.  Dough is too thick and it's just not as good as it used to be.
author: L S.

description: The bummer is that the delivery is at least 45mins -1:30 hrs.  Kill me now, it is faster for me to walk there, walk home!  The pizza is pretty good, you can order just a slice if you order other items, but the entrees have gone downhill! I use to order the chicken parm all the time, but it is not doing it for me anymore.  The funky stemmed veggies seem to come from a bag and the side of bread is just not worth it.  The half and half pasta is okay, make sure you order it as cheese not meat.  But again I think the red sauce is watery.  If that's what you're into that's cool, but recommended.
author: Nicole F.

description: They got great pizzas!  Also had their new york steak that came with spaghetti and vegetables....not bad for the price.  Their calamari was the best I've had.  However, the seafood pasta was a bit pricy and the portion was small.  I would definitely go again.
author: D D.

description:
i'm a chick... i like cheese. 
cheese delivered is even better.

the pesto deluxe pizza (no tomato sauce/pesto cuz it has cheese in it, red peppers, ricotta, garlic, pine nuts and oh, fresh mozzarella!) is my delivery speed-dial option for a chilly nite. cheesy yummy goodness.

that with a glass of red... heaven!!!
author: Missy D.

description: gotta love bella. Good inexpensive pizza, fried food, beer, and they deliver if you're too lazy to actually go there.
author: Joy T.

description: Nothing fancy or crazy, just a good pizza. Excellent delivery time, was still steaming hot when it came, which is awesome compared to the lukewarm pizza other neighborhood places have delivered. Excellent customer service over the phone as well.
author: n m.

description: I was really surprised that the clam pizza was good. the cheese is yummy on it.
author: Nancy H.

description: For some reason, I love this place. We order from here all the time beacause it's cheap and I eat so much of the plain cheese pizza... Its just so damn good and so damn cheap.
author: Adam L.

description: This is one of my favourite pizza places.  It's cheap and it's mmm mmm good.  We always get the extra large with half meatballs and pepperoni (for the boy) and half green olives and broccoli (for me) and it lasts us 3 meals.  I've never eaten there but the delivery is fast, the crust is nice and soft and it tastes great reheated the next day.  Actually I think it's even better the next day when the crust gets a bit crispier.  Also, they aren't stingy with the cheese and toppings and the sauce tastes fresh and tomatoey.  I also enjoy their mozzarella cheese sticks and like the fact that if I crave lasagna with fries (which I sometimes do) I can get it there.  Their lasagna is huge, their pizza is huge, they are so cheap and have coupons.  They have never let me down.  I love you Geary Street Pizza/Bella Pizza.
author: Dee K.

description:
Based on the reviews here (I have discovered some great restaurants on Yelp!) I called Geary Street Pizza and ordered a pie for delivery.  The woman on the phone said that it would take 45 minutes to an hour to get here, and because of these very positive reviews, I said sure, it's worth waiting for.

One hour and 15 minutes later, no pizza. So I called the place to check in, and the nice woman said that it would be here in another 15 minutes.  She did not apologize... OK, I was a bit irked, but these things happen.

20 minutes after THAT, she called me to say that the driver had delivered my pizza to someone else, and did I want that other person's pizza.   I asked where the driver was, and she said it would be another 5 minutes.  By this time I was ravenous, but didn't trust her time promises a whole lot.  btw AGAIN she did not apologize! I said forget it, hung up and whipped myself up a nice omelet, which I just finished.

Sorry to leave such a bad review for this obviously beloved place, but this was really too much.  Maybe their pizza is wonderful, and I will try it sometime, but not via delivery...
author: dan l.

description: I've eaten both at the restaurant and ordered in for delivery from this place and I can't rave enough about it. It's good, fast, cheap food! Service is quicker when you go to the restaurant instead of ordering for delivery (which can take up to an hour).
author: Dita von C.

description:
This is perhaps my favorite pizza place..EVER. The first time I tried it was probably back in 2006 and my boyfriend and I have been frequent customers ever since.The service is friendly and if you go there often the waitresses will pretty much have your order memorized.

Appetizers: Pretty cheap. I recommend the garlic bread and mozzarella sticks as basic starters.

Main Course: Most people go here for the pizza so of course  it's the best thing on their menu. Their dough is very tasty on it's own complimented very well with their yummy red sauce. I usually get a slice of West Coast which is basically just BBQ chicken, prosciutto, mushrooms and their red sauce. Their Greco Special is quite delicious as well if you like Pesto sauce and Feta cheese. They also have other specialties for those who are a little more daring, including pizza topped with clams and scallops. 

Basically: Good service and delicious (and cheap) pizza!
author: Rachel D.

description: The only reason I give Bella Pizza a 4 is because I now live too far away for them to deliver.  Best calzones I've had on the west coast thus far, and it's hard to find a good pizza place!
author: Lauren W.

description: alright so i've never actually eaten pizza from this place. so why the 4 stars you ask? they have a friggin' awesome italian sausage sandwich! i'm not usually a sausage fan but my oh my this thing was scrumptious! the oven heated sandwich comprised of italian sausage, cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, and mayo. try it, you won't be disappointed.
