author: Phil Y.

description: This is my favorite non-deep dish pizza in the city.  The crust is perfect, soft on top, but crispy on the bottom.  The sauce is slightly sweet and well apportioned.  Probably most notably, the cheese is fairly substantial and is pure mozzarella, not some kind of blend.  I almost always get two slices of cheese pizza to go, which is really four slices since they cut each giant slice in half.  This meal costs me $5.50 and is among my favorite regular meals.
author: Cassidy K.

description: not too bad for a random pizza place. when i found out they delivered, i was overjoyed! hell no, i dont want to venture out in the rain at 9pm at night to search for food. i want the food to come to me! and so it did, arriving approx 35 minutes after i ordered it. fabulous! oh and i checked the debit card.... only one charge. thanks for the heads up GG.
author: Aly L.

description: Bella, Bella, Bella!  I read reviews before I ordered.  There are some things I would personally like better; however how can anyone or any business please everyone??!!   But anyway, I had a sense for what I was in for from reading the reviews (again, we are reading from the "'public too, so who knows??!!" --  I would actually like to rate you 3-1/2 stars, but that option wasn't available.  But anyway . . actually, I think I will change it to 4 stars just to be on the positive side of things.  I have to agree with a lot of the reviews.  The pizza is quite straightforward with LOTS of generous toppings including cheese.  The sauce is so mild it is barely there (i.e., not overbearing).  This is NOT a gourmet pizza, but is a standard very doughy pizza.  If you LIKE lots of thick dough/crust, generous toppings, this is your pizza! There's nothing wrong with that either.  It's just what it is.  I think the phone order person was "okay" but warmed up a bit when I asked a few very friendly mannered questions.  I forgot to ask for "thin crust if possible" (my preferred pizza crust), but c'est la vie.  I think all-in-all, if these things described are what you want, you should go for it . ..  AND. . . in the Valu-Pak envelopes delivered weekly there is a great buy one pizza - get one 1/2 off. Not bad!  In the end, I usually opt for something a bit more on the gourmet side but those places don't deliver so Bella is just what I needed tonight.  Thank you.
author: Mikey S.

description: I just ordered calzones from this place. I havent received my order yet, so I cant comment on the food, but I just have to comment on the service of the lady on the other end of the phone. I understand pizza places get busy, but come on! I was put on hold 3 times, the first time I had to hang up and call again. Then I asked questions regarding the menu and she couldnt be more bothered. Just the attitude the whole time during taking my order makes me never want to order from them again...
author: Lindsay R.

description: Bella Pizza is a good go to spot when it's late and you need to eat.  The pizzas I've ordered have been pretty consistant and are delivered within an hour or less of when I ordered it.
author: Nicole W.

description: Haven't tried the pizza yet but I've had a calzone here and it was really good--I can vouch for the other story here about quantity, as it provided a plentiful dinner one night and a satisfying lunch the next afternoon at work...really, you can't ask for better than that.  I also appreciate the fact that they're open late--not 24 hours, but pretty late all the same.  I can't even say I'm out late much anymore, but if you've followed my reviews then you know that this is an issue that's close to my heart simply as a matter of principle, and for a city of its size, SF has terribly little in the way of edible late-night eats.  Well, a few months back Deb and I were on the hunt for vittles past 11 in our neighborhood and weren't having a lot of luck, but we stumbled across this place and gave it a try.  She got some sort of fried fish platter that was good but not outstanding, so you may well be better off sticking to their core dishes.  I'll also vouch for the sorta scary bathroom--it's got one of those plastic sinks that usually show up next to the washing machine in the cellar--but that's not what I rate a restaurant on, either.  I go for tasty food and I appreciate a place that gives generous portions for reasonable prices, and Bella scores in a  big way on those counts--just be sure to pay cash...
author: Michael T.

description: omg i love this pizza place.  their garlic pizzas are to die for.  i usually order their bella's special and change one of the veggies to garlic topping and its wonderful.  everyone is nice and wonderful.  plus they have coupons ... look at those blue envelopes that comes in the mail!
author: Vinnie L.

description: I like the idea of this place.  I like the murals on the walls - it makes you feel like you're in a small town pizza place.  The pizza is good, the pasta dishes are solid.  This place isn't fancy or date worthy - but on a lazy Sunday afternoon if you find yourself in the Richmond - try this place, it's as comfortable as an old friend.
author: Steve J.

description: Pizza options are many in the Inner Richmond, but this is our place of choice right now. Good prices and great pizza. Delivery staff's a bit rude, but what can you do? Dude's stuck in a car all day. We've had the cheese pizza, as well as one with chicken and pesto. Pesto a bit strong. They're worth trying.
author: andrea a.

description: Their pastas and calamari are delicious.  The food is consistent and it's nice that they are a small family run business.
author: My N.

description: Really good pizza...lots of CHEESE! Also their lasagna is YUM !        Check those savings coupons that always come in blue envelope with your mail . They have 3 dollars off pizza etc... Fast delivery too!
author: Camille B.

description: Great pizza. Their fried calamari is pretty good. Clean, friendly staff, nice ambiance. Got to love the fake brick. Very quick take outs too.
author: Jeff L.
